I was pretty unimpressed by this place.  It's like a neighborhood joint, except with a little larger beer selection.  The food was not good at all, the service was really bad, and there is very limited outdoor seating.  Too many other good places to go to bother here.

I liked it.  Did a sort of friend/business thing here, and it was a decent enough place for after work.  Had several of the belgian brews I like, plus a plate of hummus that was...a decent enough plate of hummus I guess.  The have a reasonably good selection of taps.  The layout is pretty much like any irishy type pub joint, and the crowd is definitely professional.  I felt like an impostor, but what the hell...when in Rome.... Overall I see this as a place that would be ideal for daytime drinkin', which seems to be a consensus here.  Not so much a stop I would make at night.

Yay finally stopped in this place after reading reviews on it here on yelp. Wow they had a pretty large list of beers which is a plus for me because I'm a beer drinker.  So had about 3 different ones.  I'm REALLY bad with remembering the names when I'm drinking but they were good.  I know that doesn't help but what I DO remember is that there starburst martini was fabulous! I switched out after awhile. They knew how to make a french martini too. So also tried the fried calamari it was pretty good no complaints. Pretty big place friendly atmosphere.  Liked da tv's all over. Need to find more places like this chill spot.

All-in-all, I'm a fan of Beer Bistro.  I have a friend who lives around the corner and we tend to go here on the weekends for "lunch," which inevitably turns into "drinks."  Hey, that's what Saturday afternoons are for, right? As far as the food goes, I've only had the BBQ chicken salad, which is very tasty and my friend always gets the chicken quesadillas. The atmosphere is nice, low-key, very pub-ish. My only complaint is that $9 for a bottle of Piraat is too much (especially considering it's only $6.50 at the Map Room), but oh well.  I'll continue to come back anyway.  Oh, and be sure to dust off your glass before you pour your beer.

I was here on a Saturday afternoon, and it satisfied my need for a daytime bar with good food. Day-drinking during spring and summer in Chicago is an unofficial "must do" for me, and I'm always looking for a new place to try out.  My friends enjoyed the extensive beer list, and were happy to see that each beer came with its own signature glass, which according to my friends is the sign of a great beer bar. I prefer drinks of the cocktail persuasion and the waitress was more than happy to make recommendations (not that I needed them, booze expert that I am). Their food was pretty good too. We had a BBQ chicken salad, chicken quesadillas, and mashed potatoes, and they were all delish.  Every time I go out in the West Loop, there are more new restaurants and bars to try. I'm glad I stopped in at Beer Bistro, and I plan on going back once it's a little warmer out and more people are partaking in my already standard day-drinking routine.

I live fairly close to this place, and it has become my backup "neighborhood" bar of choice when I just want to have some great beers and good food. The beer selection is sick, son. I don't know how many they have, but looking at the beer list brings a tear of joy to my eye. Saison Du Pont! Corsendonk! The pizza is really delicious, and the buffalo calamari makes my pants tight. The staff are always very nice, and there is some nice outdoor seating in the summer. Check out this "radical" joint if you want some great beers in the West Loop.

The Beer Bistro has a very good selection of beer -- probably almost 100 well-chosen beers. There are a lot of things here that I haven't found in many other places in Chicago. The menu is very good for a casual restaurant. It's definitely a cut above your typical bar/ pub. Burgers are good, but the pizza is great, too, and appetizers are fun to try. The service is usually good and the servers know their beer. I go to the Beer Bistro before Bulls and Hawks games. It's a good West Loop location right on Madison, a little more than halfway between downtown and the United Center. I've never had a problem getting in and out of there before the games.

This is the go-to bar and restaurant for when we aren't feeling adventurous enough to try something new.  The pepperoni and goat cheese pizza is to die for. I started writing about the buffalo calamari and my mouth started watering. The BLT was okay and the steak sandwich was alright. Their chips are delicious. I highly recommend any of their pizzas- and of course the beer selection blows my Coors-Light-addled mind.  I can't wait for summer when the front windows are all the way open! OH and the one time I tried to use the bathroom some old drunk guy had left the door open and was taking a wiz. Beware.

A great place to get a drink in the West Loop.  I've met a former co worker here on several occasions and have loved the service and beer selection. They lose a star for the food.  It's passable and uninspired to say the least.

Their selection of beer is jus phenomenal - they have a few chocolately beers, fruity ones and one even tastes like Banana Bread ( i personally would not recommend that one)  I work a mile away from Beer Bistro and try to get out here @least once a month for some really good beer selection and pretty good burgers. Last I time i went, I tried some new beers. Goose Island Bourbon County Stout is jus AMAZING. As a rule, I go for the lighter beers but this one was jus blew me away. Good location, nice atmosphere and a huge variety of brews you won't find everywhere.

I wish I could give this place more stars, I really do.  They have an awesome selection of beers, the decor is cozy, and I love the West Loop.  Beer Bistro is less than a mile from the Metra, and we  had no trouble finding street parking.  However . . . There are only two bathrooms, both unisex and both only one lou.  They were both disgusting.  (trust me, I don't use the term lightly.  I spent a month in Bolivia, seriously 3rd world, so now I have VERY low standards for bathrooms.  usually just plumbing is enough to make me happy.)  There was TP all over the floor, pee on the seat and when I sat down . . brace yourself . . .there was water squirting out from the pipe that regardless of how I repositioned my squat, was unavoidable.  I seriously threw up in my mouth a little bit. It was also IMPOSSIBLE to get drinks.  The bar was packed (it was post Blackhawks game), and there were only 2 bartenders!  Both times I went up for drinks I ended up waiting over 10 minutes.  Sooo not worth it.
This place rocks for having the widest selection of beers I have found in Chicago. Next to small bar on division st. in wicker park.

This place was not bad at all.  When we couldn't get into Jerry's (they close at 6:30???) we wandered down the street and into this place.   6:30 pm is absolutely the peak time at this place, but they found a table for my husband and me and our 4 year old daughter.  She ate all her mac & cheese and most of his tater tots.  My pizza was good and it all came pretty quickly.   It's mostly bar food, but it's pretty good bar food, and they were very nice.  I would definitely go back if I were in the neighborhood.

Fabulous concept, disappointing execution.  The beer selection is somewhat interesting but not a huge selection on tap, most are in bottles.  The beer on tap is too warm. The service is not so great, and I am really getting sick of crappy service in bars in the West Loop, South Loop area.  If my beer is halfway full you should probably start thinking about asking me if I want another one.  If my beer has one inch left in the bottom, you should probably hang around by me instead of running off to the back room, never to be seen again.  If my beer is empty and you are nowhere to be found? Then I'm leaving. The food is decent here, wings are good.  Tater tots are good but how can you screw those up.  I don't know, I think i could personally put together a better beer-complimenting menu than Beer Bistro's.   I will have to be cajoled to go back.

3 stars for the MASSIVE beer list (but of course, that's what i expect from the name). and -2 stars because the food was sub par. we dropped in on quiet madison after a bulls game on a sunday...and since most things were closed we settled on beer bistro. the sign in the window said 25 cent wings - my boyf was sold on that! my girlfriend and i saw that they had salads, since we were trying to eat healthy...but i never ended up ordering one anyways, ha! my boyf & i ordered: - buffalo wings (ok, not too saucy which i like - but boyf gave them an OK rating) - basil and goat cheese pizza (floppy floppy floppy thin crust - if i waited until it got cold, it would have been easier to eat. the taste was really non-existent, they could have really put more goat cheese on, it was bogged down with more mozz than anything else and the crust was doughy as hell!) my friend and her boyf got: - mac 'n cheese (runny and flavorless) - goat cheese & pep pizza (we've already been through this...flop city) - chopped salad (the ingredients were chopped, but the lettuce wasn't...what? i'm confused!!) we ordered delirium, which i love and love that they had that on tap...and they give you the beer brand's glass, so that's always exciting (small pleasures, people!). service was fine, she did a run down of the beers - but did not explain which each one was like (call me crazy, but the name doesn't help in my ordering...i like to know what it's suppose to taste like. i know that's not her job unless i ask her to explain them, but that would take forever and would be rude to do! but maybe the menu's job? would have been cool to have the descriptions of the many beers.) the food was just OK bar food...if you want to try their beers, go in on a sunday and get the wings for cheap...or just go in for the beer selection any day.

Good menu, 5 dollar pizzas are a GREAT value. The beer list is good and service always seems to be very quick.  The bus boys are some of the best ive ever seen at staying in top of your table.  All in all its a west loop staple that isnt nearly as busy as the recently trendy west end.

I came here with a friend before a Bulls game and the place was packed.  We lucked out because two guys stood up right as we entered and we grabbed their table.  Classy-looking place with a lot of beer signs on the walls, a nice long bar, and tap handles that you can see from across the room. The waitress took a while to come by, but was fast once we got her attention.  Looking at the giant pink elephant tap handle, we ordered two Delirium Tremens.  The waitress brought our beers out... in bottles.  Now, maybe they didn't have Delirium Tremens on tap (maybe the Noel was on tap?), and maybe we should have clarified that we wanted beers off the tap.  But still, something to keep in mind for the next time I go. It was a Tuesday and they had a $2 burger special.  I asked the waitress if it was a normal-sized burger.  She replied unenthusiastically, "Yeah but it's just like a plain burger."  A plain burger?  Conflicted, I ordered the fish and chips.  My friend ordered the burger, "but could I get tomato, cheese, etc, etc on that?"  The waitress said no problem and walked away.  So next time, I will try the burger for $2.  My friend said it was good.  The fish and chips were also good... but not $2.  Oh, and parking will be slightly tough before a Bulls game if you didn't know already.

Heeeeey!!!  How's it goin'!!!  I haven't seen you since...wow, check her out... We just havd a few friends come wiff to here... Beer?  Yeah, I'll have one.  Oh, wait...I gotta finish this... What's on special?  Yeah, it's more hoppy and more wheaty, but does it have alcohol?  Den bring it.  $3.50 something different?  Nice!  Oh, i have my Beer card and I need to fill it. Food?  Yeah, I'm STARFVING.  Special?  $2 Burgers?  1/2 price appetiters?  $5 pizza?  Yeah, when?  Oh, different daze... Don't you have those little mini-burgers?  Wings?  Chicken nachoes?  Nachooooooo!!  That movie was so FUNNY.  Nachooooooo!!   Hows the pizza?  It's okay... Man, there's, like no place to sit!  So, i have lean up against this table... sorry, I didn't see you sitting there.   Hey, don't you have a back room?  Yeah, i went to a party there once.  I LOVE THIS PLACE TOO...Nachooooooo!!

My companion and I stopped in after a hockey game to get some food that doesn't cost a million dollars and come in a cardboard box.  Shocking, I know.  They have an insane selection of beers including Goose Island Bourbon County Stout which I love, despite its hefty pricetag (my one stout cost more than my dinner alone and my companion's dinner and beer combined, apparently I am not a cheap date).  I got a chopped salad which was full of a wide variety of fresh greens including one of my favorites, frisee and the waitress had no problem substituting a different cheese.  I like to be difficult, I know.  My companion enjoyed the 25cent wings and we enjoyed being able to just hang out a little bit longer without breaking the bank.  We absolutely spent more on snacks at the game than we did here.  They also have quite a few tv's if you want to catch a game.  Thanks to that, I got to spend another Sunday looking into the pretty boy face of my dad's secret gay boyfriend (he wishes), Payton Manning.  Great.  I'll definitely be back, Payton Manning or not.  Or should I say, my new step-dad (again, my dad wishes)

I love the Beer Bistro. Just so y'all know, my friends and I are re-doing their website. But I would go there several nights a week no matter my connection with the place. Bob is great. So is the wait-staff. The specials are awesome and the place hits the neighborhood feel spot-on. Grab the beer checkoff card and get yourself a "free" case of beer when you finish. I've been to the Map Room and love its selection. But I prefer the Bistro. It's close, it's super friendly and just a good time. It doesn't try to be something it's not. And especially important to me, it's not packed with people that now have a place to go down the street. As a note: it is frowned-upon to take a little nap in the downstairs area.

I love this bar, it is very neigborhoody, just what the west loop needed, and they have $2 burgers every Tuesday, they are really good, oh 50c more if you want cheese!!!  They also offer beers of the month at great prices, so I have learned to appreciate beer a lot more!!!!  Definitely worth checking out, and you can pare beers with your food!!
Bob is the shit and while the beer prices could stand to be a bit lower, the bartenders will give you free shots all night long, so if you're into shots, it's a deal.

I'm not sure if I should be damning Bob or thanking him immensely.  I think thanks are in order though.  Bob is what all bartenders should be: knowledgeable about his beers, fun, attentive, and willing to have a shot or two with a customer. So, Bob, thank you!  This giant stein of Spaten is for you, this shot of Jameson is for you!  But next time, let's skip that Red Headed Slut, if you don't mind ...

I agree with most of the other reviews that compared to Map Room and Hopleaf this place falls a bit short.  The space isn't too bad and I would have liked to sit out on the patio to soak in as much Chicago summer as one can get, but we ended up in the back.  The apps were ok (wings and nachos) and the beer was decent.  I just don't think I would be coming back here with such wonderful options elsewhere.  There is a preponderance of TV's however, so if you intend to catch a game (Cubs, Sox, etc.) this might be a good option.

Just stumbled upon this little hot spot for the first time. I was greeted with a smile, served my vodka/grapefruit in a timely matter and then I just couldn't resist the menu of beer.  I ended up with Fullers from London, damn good beer!! I can't wait to dive into their daily specials like $.25 wings on Sundays, or $2 on Tuesdays (too bad I travel during the week)

I really dig this place.  The beer selection is great, and bartender are very attentive and fun.  They also have Beer School on the occasional Wednesday night!  Clearly, this is where I should have gone for my master's.  Damnit.   Parking is good on Aberdeen (just west of the Bistro). Warning-Be prepared to drop a few coins...

Hmmmmm.  I wasn't really impressed with this place at all.  It's in a nice spot in the west loop, but both the food and drinks were lacking here.  Which is kind of the point of a bar/restaurant.   I went on a Thursday for half-priced appetizers and $5 martinis.  I assure you I didn't order a virgin martini, but that's about what it tasted like.  Even if a drink is on special, you still have to put alcohol in it.  That's really the point of a drink, right?   For dinner, I had a burger ordered done medium.  It was overcooked, chewy, and flavorless.  The parmesan chips served on the side were pretty nice, however.  My friend paid extra for the fries, but they were pretty ordinary, so i'd stick with the chips if i were you.  That's about all I have to say about that.   Positive:  lots of cute boys there.  I'm off the market so wasn't pursuing, but boy if i was, there was a virtual smorgasboard to choose from!  Nice!

This place has the potential to be massively disastrous, because it is so close to my gym.  I went there this past weekend, because I wanted a beer- not a lite, but an actual BEER.  Boy did they have a pretty good selection.  They have a good selection of beer on tap, which made it nice to sample- the bartenders were nice and informed about the new brews on tap.  They have two or three Goose Island beers on tap, but I have a hard time drinking them now that Budweiser bought them out. :(   Overall, good place to chill and have a real beer.  I'll be back.

Had a blast here last night.  Garage door type open windows made it feel like a giant beer garden even though there were only a few outdoor tables.  Such a fun beer list - loved trying something different - I had a corona-like beer called Pacifico and the Bistro Chips - yummy fresh cut potato chips served warm with parmesan and salt.  Mmmmm :)

My co-workers and I go here often for $2 burger Tuesdays at lunch and the great selection of beer. The burgers are perfect every time and go well with tater tots. Its uncanny. I tend to order the Goose Island reserve of Matilda they have on tap. (After work, natch.) Also kudos to whoever manages their spot on selection of 80s music.

I've been to this West Loop pub often, and usually have a great experience.  HUGE selection of beers, decent food, and great specials.  I highly recommend the Mac and Cheese and their version of a slider.  Both go down well with a cold one.  Not sure what kind of beer to order, just check the menu, and all food items come with a beer suggestion.   The crowd is becoming quite eclectic.  Business suits, hard hats, and tourists(N.Siders) and locals can be found here everyday.  Going with a group, send someone early and grab the semi-private nook towards the back!! When it first opened, the wait staff and owner were extremely helpful in choosing beers, and were incredibly friendly.  Our server often would sit and chat for a few minutes.  Now this placed is packed, with folks maneuvering to try to get a seat, and it has lost some of its charm....they are just too busy to extend themselves.    The owner, who kinda resembles a gnome, or blond Mario brother, still offers great selections if you can hunt him down.  Busy or not, I know I will be back.   Don't miss the $2 burgers, it's Tuesday's special.  Good lunch option.

The bartenders/wait staff are fantastic here!  They are very attentive and will go as far as changing the channel on their flat screen tvs to whatever you desire.  There's a nice lounge area in the back that seats ten - 15 people.  Prices aren't bad, and groups pretty much keep to themselves.  Great for a happy hour after work!

The service here is definitely lacking.  I've been given the "hold on" finger one too many times.  The only reason I return is the daily specials ($5 burgers, 1/2 off appetizers, wing night, martini night, etc.) and the convenience of the location.   All in all, a very cute neighborhood bar w/ alright food.
Great Beer list, in fact something like 100 beers, and mixed drinks. Love their food, especially the wraps. Always a fun time! Finally a good bar close to my home!

Ahh, The Beer Bistro. I began going here because it is so close to my house, but now I think I would continue to frequent it even if I lived farther away. They have a great beer selection and the food can also be pretty good. They have great burgers and I also really enjoy their blackened chicken dinner. Make sure you try their homemade chips, they are excellent! There are a few flat screen TVs hanging around the bar area that are very nice for watching sporting events. My only complaint here is that the bar area is fairly small and can get pretty crowded on Friday and Saturday nights, but what good place doesn't.

I don't often venture into the West Loop, but maybe this place has changed my mind.  This stylish bar has a nice selection of beers.  They also feature daily specials to keep you coming back.  I recommend the $2 burger night (which I think is Tuesday).  Order 2 or 3!  I did, and I'm still full.  Go with a nice-sized group and take over the comfy VIP booth in the back corner.

I really like this place.  Been there many times since I live close by.  Cheap eats during the week: $5 pizza on Monday and 1/2 price apps Thursday.  Tons of beer on tap, friendly crowd and bartenders.   Good place to go with a small group any day of the week.

Their vast beer selection earns this place 2 stars, otherwise this place was a nightmare.  First, someone who works in this place needs to realize that heat should be adjusted depending on the temp. outside. If it is 1 degree outside it would be a good idea to move the thermostat a bit to the right. As a result, we ended up moving tables 3 times, all the while maintaining layers. Second, the food was mediocre at best, even for regular bar fare.  Third, the staff could be a bit more attentive to how much they have already overserved their customers. My friend and I were so harassed by a group of fiercely drunk men that we had to flag down a waitress and ask her to get the bouncer once they had thrown the glass ashtray on the floor and knocked over our drinks. Again...nightmare.

I agree with the other reviewers, this is a clean and cozy spot.  It is a great neighborhood bar/restaurant with some personality.  Love the exposed brick and the drapey velvet thing...it kicks the mood up a notch. My first visit was on a Wednesday night w/a girlfriend in this horrific below zero weather...we were looking for comfort food and a place where we could hear each other talk.  We definitely found that atmosphere at Beer Bistro. We enjoyed the food and while we drank wine instead of beer, their list of beer offerings is quite impressive. I can't wait to tell my West Loop friends what I found in their 'hood!

Well...finally, a cool bar in the westloop.  Sure, it's a little bit lincoln park, but the neighborhood is changing rapidly, and I welcome the change.   The beer selection is amazing....very clean environment.  Waitstaff are good...lets face it, it's a bar, not The Capital Grille.   Burger deal on tuesday is fantastic.   Bloody bar is terrific too.

I just went here the other night.  The food was good for $2 burgers, the service not so much.  Maybe the waitress was upset because we moved two tables together or maybe she just didn't care, but either way she didn't give us much service.  It was pretty crowded for a Tuesday night and it looked like they had a lot of great specials.  Will I go back, probably.  Maybe I'll get a different server next time.

I was there twice on a Friday night in January 2007 before & after a (lousy) show at the UIC Pavillion.  Once around happy hour (4 - 6 pm) and then I went back from around 10 pm - 1 am.  I'll talk first about the beer, then the peripherals. Beer: Outstanding selection (!) listed on menus, but the menu doesn't list specials, indicate tap/bottle or tell you the PRICE!  When your beer can range from $5 to $10, it would be good to know that ahead of time.  My favorite of the evening: Corsendonk Abbey Brown... smooth and delicious and cost $8. Happy Hour:  Sat in the non-smoking section in back, but smoke still evident from the front.  Plenty of seats at 4, but they were all gone shortly after 5.  Not very loud so it was easy to have a conversation.  We ordered a hummus plate appetizer (~$6) and the goat cheese & pepperoni pizza (~$12).  The hummus was average, but the pitas were served warm, which I like.  The pizza had a thin crust and was quite good - lots of cheese, not too greasy.  Our waitress seemed a bit overwhelmed (perhaps they were understaffed?) but did a good job. Evening: It was very full at 10 pm and we were lucky to find a small table up against the front window.  It was freezing cold and kind of smokey.  Much louder, but could still hold a conversation.  Got a basket of some kind of deep fried potato chip this time... mmmmm, greasy goodness with coarse salt.  Our waitress did a fabulous job given the crowd and table bussers were hypervigilant, almost intrusive. Bathrooms: 1 upstairs (in the very back) and 2 downstairs.  All were reasonably clean and well-maintained.

I've only been here for lunch and it's ok.  But just so.  The specials are usually a good deal, especially the $5 pizza on Mondays.  Unfortunately, the service has much to be desired and needs improvement.  The servers just don't move fast enough, even when there are only 3 other tables in there.  I don't know, maybe the service is better at night?

I went to a game at the United Center last night and I had to get some dinner first.  I had considered Subway until I remembered this spot.  And since I'm always looking for a new place to try some good beer, I decided to try it out. It's a long, dark bar in the traditional Chicago style.  Fairly well appointed, all things considered.  There is a lower-level, in the basement, but I never made it down. The beer selection is pretty good.   The list is not the kind of things dreams are made of, but the options are all solid and robust enough that it should keep anyone happy.  To me, the best option has got to be the Goose Island Reserve series, with one on tap and several others in the bottle.  I had some nice GI Imperial IPA and was a happy camper. My food, however, was only lackluster especially considering the price.  I ordered the Blackened Chicken Breast and steamed broccoli.  The chicken breast was about the size of a cell phone.  The flavor was good and the broccoli was solid, but at $11 I felt a little ripped off.   It wasn't too crowded, by any means, but it was a rainy Monday night, so I'm not at all surprised.   I don't make it out that way all too often and I don't see this place changing that.  However, if I am out that way, I'd be happy to stop by and get some good beer.  Hopefully, I'll be smart enough to order a $8 burger and be content with that.

I'd give this place three and a half stars.  This was a nice, cozy bar, and wasn't to crowded, but not empty, on a Saturday night.  They've got a large beer selection, and if you order all of their Christmas ales (there are 12 of them!) in December, you get a shirt!  Whoopee for a free shirt.  Hey, that deserves an extra star!

Pretty great place.  Good beer selection, great atmosphere, and good food specials during the week.  I would recommend it for meeting up with friends. Update!!!  I love BB.  The pizza is outstanding, the bartenders are great, and I am so glad that it is my neighborhood bar. I always feel welcome here (unlike the pretentious Third Rail Tavern a few doors down-- check out that review).  Matt is a great bartender, never skews you the wrong way with beer recommendations.

they pair up the beer and food! i love that.  there is a wonderful beer selection.  the food is good.  all of the servers have been pretty good.  I really like the owner, Bob.  he's extremely nice and helpful.  he always remembers who i am.  he has even come by my barbershop for a haircut.  i've never been in the bar when it's real busy.  i usually go on sunday afternoons and eat 25 cent wings.  i have not had a lot off the menu, but i've been impressed with what i've had.

As a bar this place is decent.  Clean, neat, newer and all that.  Kinda yuppified sportsy bar, but that goes with the 'hood.  Food, however, is just average.  I had a grilled cheese panini and fries and my roomie had some sort of chicken sandwich with the chips.  Shoulda gotten the sea salt covered chips with my sandwich because the fries were very blah. Also...service leaves MUCH to be desired. In summation~ Beer selection = pretty gosh darn good.  Food and crowd and ambience and service = pretty darn blah. (except for the fresh herb goat cheese pizza, which merits an additional half star - it is yummy!)

**UPDATE** They have daily specials that are good deals, but they do not tell you that Thursday's special isnt until after 5 pm...so the half price app's are not all day like every other special they offer. It really sucks that they dont have any signs or notes on the menu to let you know. I go there often and the specials are all day everyday, so it was a shock to get the bill today and have it all be full price. its a bummer, such a good place...but yet...not really clear on thier Thursday specials. :(  Great burgers, great home made circle cut fries, THE BEST bbq chicken salad, great atmosphere.  MON: $5 Pizza's, TUES: $2 Burgers, SUN: .25 Cent wings! Sometimes the staff isn't the nicest...but maybe they just had a bad day. I haven't had a Jim Beam there yet.

One of the best beer selections in the West Loop, and very good pizza, too!  They have a very extensive beer list, and they seem to have most of them on hand when I order them, which is good considering the number of bottles on the list.  And the food is definitely better than what I expected for a bar.  It can be a bit expensive, but they do have really good specials. Many of the beers are $1 or $2 more than you'd spend at most other places.  However, the atmosphere and the quality of the meals make the prices a bit more bearable.  The service is inconsistent, but usually better than average - though the servers generally aren't as knowledgeable about the beers as I would expect, given the name of the place.  It does seem that, even when crowded, it's fairly easy to have a conversation with those at your table, so that makes it a good place to gather for a beer or two with a couple friends after dinner.  I can't give it 5 stars because it's just too expensive for what you get, but it's a good place to go for a decent meal and good beer.

I felt like I was right back in Seattle when I visited the Beer Bistro. It was dark and warm, and, with beer being the main course, I couldn't have been happier. All it needed was a downpour and it would've been the epitome of "Seattle pub".  They have about 75 bottled beers and a great assortment of beers on tap. Not to mention a monthly ale special and great food. I recommend the spinach and artichoke dip...you have to work hard to screw something like this up, but theirs was the best I've had.  The space is long and narrow, so large groups have to wait a bit for a table together. But it's a great spot if you're with one or two others. I really enjoyed myself here and would definitely go back!
